Leah_spouse: Hey. I'm paying my respects to another bygone summer. I'll come meet up with you when we launch the candle-boat. #!String
Abigail: Such a rare and exciting thing... #!String
Robin: *yawn*... It's past my bed-time.$s#$e#Hey, did you see that candle-boat? I crafted it myself.$h #!String

Demetrius: The 'Moonlight Jelly'... what a remarkable species! We're very lucky that they stop here on their long journey south.#$e#It's unknown why they are attracted to light... very curious. #!String
Maru: It's kind of cold, actually. I guess fall is right around the corner. #!String
Sebastian: I thought I saw something moving in there... something big, something dark.#$e#Just trying to scare you...$h #!String
Pierre: Psst... Make sure to swing by the shop tomorrow to get your fall seeds! #!String
Caroline: These candles are romantic, aren't they? #!String
Linus: I'll just sneak up when the jellies arrive... I don't want to bother anyone. #!String
Alex: I can't believe summer's over... I feel like it just started.$s #!String
George: What, why are you looking at me like that? You think I'm too old to enjoy something like this? #!String
Evelyn: I remember seeing the jellies once, as a little girl. Oh, how I jumped with joy when they arrived!#$e#But that was long ago... I'm a lot less energetic now. #!String
Lewis: Good evening, @. The Moonlight Jellies are close... I already saw one glowing in the distance.#$b#Once we launch the candle-boat they'll come up to the docks and say hello. #!String
Clint: I wore my special shoes tonight... No one noticed.$s #!String
Emily: Look out there, at the endless sea. Deep underwater, all kinds of life forms are moving around in the dark.#$b#Eerie, isn't it? #!String
Penny: Life is so easy for a jellyfish... just letting the waves carry you onward forever. #!String
Pam: Don't tell Gus, but I'm a little disappointed there's no buffet tonight. #!String
Haley: I should've brought my camera! I always forget.$s #!String
Jodi: There! I just saw something glowing!#$b#Oh... It's gone.$s #!String
Kent: Good evening, @. Hope you can find some time to relax before the harvest season. #!String
Sam: I wonder if they're poisonous?#$e#Maybe I shouldn't push Sebastian in the water after all...$h #!String
Leah: Hey. I'm paying my respects to another bygone summer. #!String
Shane: The jellies were here a year ago, and they'll be back again a year from now... nature is amazing. #!String
Marnie: That's a heavy load of people for an ancient wooden dock! I'll stay over here near the beach. #!String
Elliott: If we keep polluting the oceans, the jellies will surely go extinct. It's already in the process of happening.#$e#What a shame... we have no respect for nature anymore. #!String
Gus: 'Moonlight Jellies'... I wonder how they taste?$h#$b#I would never try it, of course!$u #!String
Dwarf: You say it's raining up above? *gasp*#$e#Rain... It's almost mythical to us. Some of us live our entire lives without ever experiencing it. #!String

Wizard: How did you find me back here? I thought I was well-hidden.#$b#Perhaps you are blessed with the gift of clairvoyance.#$e#I'm here to observe the Lunaloos... or 'Moonlight Jellies', as you call them. They possess an unusually potent magical aura for an aquatic life form. #!String
Harvey: Well, summer's over. To be honest, I'll be happy to say goodbye to these blasted mosquitos! #!String
Sandy: I heard it's raining back home. Is that why you came here?$h#$e#I kind of miss the rain, actually...$s #!String
Jas: I hope there are babies this year! #!String
Vincent: I wanna see the rare green jelly! #!String
Willy: Most night-fish would be scared of the light... these are strange ones. #!String
Leo: The moonlight jellies are my old friends... they come to the island every year, too. #!String
